definitions: unexpected difficulty or disadvantage that suddenly appears in a process or plan
rough or sharp projection from a surface, especially a dead tree branch
torn or pulled thread creating a hole or run in fabric
examples: We hit a snag when the supplier suddenly raised their prices
The project encountered several snags during the implementation phase
The canoe scraped against a snag jutting from the riverbank
Dead snags provide important habitat for woodpeckers and other wildlife
She caught her sweater on a nail and created a snag
The delicate fabric had several snags from rough handling

definitions: soft-bodied mollusk with a spiral shell that moves slowly on a muscular foot
person who moves or acts very slowly
examples: Garden snails can damage plants by eating their leaves
The French restaurant served escargot prepared with garlic butter
Don't be such a snail; we need to leave in five minutes
Traffic moved at a snail's pace during rush hour

definitions: long limbless reptile with a scaly body that moves by slithering
deceitful or treacherous person who betrays trust
flexible tool used to clear blocked pipes and drains
examples: The snake slithered silently through the tall grass
Venomous snakes inject toxin through their hollow fangs
He turned out to be a snake who sold company secrets
Watch out for that snake; she'll stab you in the back
The plumber used a snake to clear the clogged drain
We need a longer snake to reach the main sewer line

definitions: wound inflicted by the bite of a snake, especially a venomous one
alcoholic drink made with beer and cider mixed together
examples: The hiker was rushed to hospital after suffering a snakebite
Antivenom is the primary treatment for venomous snakebites
He ordered a snakebite at the pub on Friday night
The bartender mixed equal parts lager and cider for the snakebite

definitions: sharp cracking sound made when something breaks or is broken suddenly
fastening device that clicks together when pressed
informal photograph taken quickly without preparation
sudden quick movement or action done with force
examples: The twig broke with a loud snap under his foot
We heard the snap of breaking bones during the collision
The jacket has snaps instead of buttons down the front
Baby clothes often use snaps for easy changing
Let me take a quick snap of you by the fountain
She posted several snaps from her vacation on social media
The dog made a snap at the mailman's ankle
Her snap decision to quit surprised everyone

definitions: garden plant with colorful flowers shaped like a dragon's mouth that open when squeezed
old Christmas game involving raisins in burning brandy
examples: The snapdragons bloomed in vibrant reds and yellows along the garden path
Children love squeezing snapdragon flowers to make them open
Victorian families played snapdragon at Christmas parties despite the danger
The snapdragon game required snatching raisins from flaming brandy

definitions: edible marine fish with sharp teeth found in warm coastal waters
person who takes photographs, especially an amateur or paparazzi
common name for a snapping turtle with powerful jaws
examples: Red snapper is a popular dish in coastal restaurants
The fisherman caught several snappers near the reef
The celebrity tried to avoid the snappers waiting outside
Wedding snappers captured every moment of the ceremony
The snapper's powerful jaws can easily break a finger
A large snapper was spotted in the pond

definitions: informal photograph taken quickly and spontaneously without artistic preparation
record of computer system or data state at a specific moment
brief summary or overview providing insight into a situation
examples: She keeps family snapshots in her wallet
The tourist took snapshots of every monument they visited
The backup software creates hourly snapshots of the database
System administrators can restore from yesterday's snapshot
This report provides a snapshot of current market conditions
The survey offers a snapshot of public opinion

definitions: device for catching animals consisting of a noose that tightens when triggered
wire stretched across the bottom of a snare drum creating its distinctive sound
situation or plan designed to trick or catch someone
examples: The hunter set snares along the rabbit trails
Wildlife officers removed illegal snares from the forest
The drummer adjusted the snare to get a crisper sound
The snare rattled with each hit of the drumstick
The criminals fell into the police snare during the sting operation
Beware of investment snares that promise unrealistic returns

definitions: quick grabbing or seizing action done suddenly and often roughly
small piece or brief portion of something heard or seen
Olympic weightlifting movement lifting the barbell overhead in one motion
examples: The thief made a snatch for her purse at the bus stop
The eagle made a successful snatch of the fish
I only heard snatches of their conversation through the door
She hummed snatches of old songs while working
His snatch technique needs improvement before the competition
She set a new record in the snatch category

definitions: person who moves or acts stealthily to avoid detection
advance showing or preview given secretly before official release
informal term for sneaker or athletic shoe
examples: The sneak crept through the house while everyone slept
Don't be a sneak; just ask permission directly
Critics got a sneak of the new movie last week
The company offered a sneak peek at their upcoming products
He wore his favorite sneaks to the basketball game
Those are nice sneaks; where did you get them?

definitions: soft rubber-soled shoe designed for sports or casual wear
examples: She laced up her sneakers before the morning jog
High-top sneakers provide extra ankle support for basketball
Designer sneakers have become expensive fashion statements
The gym requires clean sneakers on the court

definitions: sudden involuntary expulsion of air through nose and mouth caused by irritation
examples: Her loud sneeze startled everyone in the quiet library
Pepper always makes him sneeze uncontrollably
The doctor said his frequent sneezes were due to allergies
Cover your sneeze to prevent spreading germs

definitions: act or condition of repeatedly expelling air through nose and mouth involuntarily
examples: Her constant sneezing during spring indicates hay fever
The sneezing fit lasted for several minutes
Excessive sneezing can be a symptom of the common cold
The cat's sneezing worried its owner

definitions: audible inhalation through the nose to smell or clear nasal passages
small amount or trace of something detected or present
preliminary investigation or examination of something
examples: She gave a disdainful sniff at his suggestion
The dog's sniff confirmed the presence of drugs
There wasn't a sniff of evidence against him
He didn't get a sniff of playing time all season
The accountant took a sniff at the company's books
Investors are taking a sniff at the new startup

definitions: trained animal, especially a dog, used to detect substances by smell
electronic device or software that detects and analyzes data or substances
person who investigates or searches for specific information
examples: The sniffer dog found explosives in the luggage
Airport security uses sniffers to detect prohibited items
The network sniffer detected unauthorized access attempts
Gas sniffers help locate dangerous leaks
The talent sniffer discovered several future stars
Corporate sniffers investigate financial irregularities

definitions: military or police marksman who shoots targets from a concealed position at long range
person who makes petty criticisms or attacks from a position of safety
examples: The sniper took position on the rooftop overlooking the square
Police snipers were deployed during the hostage situation
The political sniper attacked opponents through anonymous social media posts
Office snipers criticize projects but never offer solutions

definitions: small piece or brief extract from something larger
small section of reusable programming code
examples: The article included snippets from the celebrity's interview
She shared snippets of conversation she overheard
The programmer saved useful code snippets in a library
This snippet handles user authentication efficiently

definitions: person who secretly gives information about someone's wrongdoing to authorities
act of secretly reporting someone's activities to authorities
examples: Nobody likes a snitch in the neighborhood
The snitch provided crucial information to the police
He threatened revenge for her snitch to the teacher
That snitch cost him his job

definitions: person who believes they are superior to others based on taste, wealth, or social position
examples: The wine snob refused to drink anything under fifty dollars
Don't be such a snob about popular music
The social snobs at the club looked down on newcomers
She's a literary snob who only reads obscure authors

definitions: behavior or attitudes characteristic of a snob showing feelings of superiority
examples: His snobbery about coffee shops is insufferable
The club's snobbery keeps many qualified people from joining
Academic snobbery prevents collaboration between institutions
She overcame the snobbery of the fashion industry

definitions: cue sport played on a table with colored balls and specific scoring rules
situation where someone is prevented from taking action or put at disadvantage
examples: He won the snooker championship three years running
The snooker hall stays open until midnight
The new regulations have snookered small businesses
We were completely snookered by their legal maneuver

definitions: person who pries into others' private affairs without permission
act of secretly investigating or searching through someone's belongings
examples: The neighborhood snoop knows everyone's business
Don't be a snoop; respect their privacy
His snoop through her phone destroyed their trust
A quick snoop revealed nothing suspicious

definitions: loud breathing sound made during sleep when air flow causes throat tissues to vibrate
examples: His loud snoring kept the entire household awake
The doctor recommended a sleep study for her snoring
Chronic snoring can indicate sleep apnea
The snoring from the next room was unbearable

definitions: tube allowing a swimmer to breathe while face-down in water
raised air intake on vehicles for crossing deep water
examples: She breathed through the snorkel while observing the coral reef
The snorkel got water in it when the wave hit
The military vehicle's snorkel allowed river crossing
Off-road enthusiasts install snorkels for water crossings

definitions: swimming activity using a snorkel to observe underwater life while breathing at surface
act of swimming or exploring underwater areas using snorkel equipment
examples: Snorkeling in the Caribbean revealed colorful tropical fish
We went snorkeling every morning during our beach vacation
The resort offers snorkeling lessons for beginners
Snorkeling requires calm water and good visibility

definitions: projecting nose and mouth of an animal, especially a mammal
thing resembling an animal's snout in shape or position
examples: The pig pushed its snout through the fence searching for food
The dog's wet snout left marks on the window
The glacier's snout extended into the valley
The airplane's snout contained the radar equipment

definitions: atmospheric water vapor frozen into ice crystals falling as white flakes
white spots or interference on a television or display screen
slang term for cocaine
examples: Heavy snow closed the mountain passes for three days
Children built snowmen in the fresh snow
The old TV showed nothing but snow after midnight
Adjust the antenna to reduce the snow
Police found snow hidden in the vehicle's compartment
The dealer was arrested for selling snow

definitions: ball of packed snow formed for throwing or rolling
situation that increases rapidly in size or importance
cocktail made with advocaat liqueur and lemonade
examples: The children threw snowballs at each other in the yard
The snowball grew larger as it rolled down the hill
The small protest snowballed into a nationwide movement
Debt can snowball if you only pay minimum amounts
She ordered a snowball cocktail at the holiday party
The bartender garnished the snowball with a cherry

definitions: board resembling a wide ski used for gliding down snow-covered slopes
examples: He waxed his snowboard before hitting the slopes
The rental shop had snowboards in various sizes
Her new snowboard performed well in powder snow
Professional snowboards can cost over a thousand dollars

definitions: person who rides a snowboard down snow-covered slopes as sport or recreation
examples: The professional snowboarder won three Olympic medals
Snowboarders gathered at the terrain park for practice
Young snowboarders dominated the halfpipe competition
The resort attracts snowboarders from around the world

definitions: sport or activity of descending snow-covered slopes while standing on a snowboard
examples: Snowboarding became an Olympic sport in 1998
She took snowboarding lessons during winter vacation
The resort offers excellent snowboarding on groomed trails
Snowboarding requires good balance and core strength

definitions: amount of snow that falls in a particular area during a specific period
instance or period when snow falls from the sky
examples: The region recorded its heaviest snowfall in decades
Annual snowfall in the mountains exceeds ten feet
The first snowfall of winter arrived early this year
Heavy snowfall disrupted transportation throughout the city

definitions: single ice crystal that falls as snow with unique symmetrical pattern
person perceived as overly sensitive or easily offended
derogatory term for millennials considered unable to handle adversity
examples: Each snowflake has a unique crystalline structure
Snowflakes melted as soon as they touched the ground
Don't be such a snowflake about constructive criticism
He called them snowflakes for complaining about work conditions
OK boomer, says the snowflake generation in response
The snowflake label unfairly stereotypes young adults

definitions: figure resembling a person made from packed snow, typically with stones for features
examples: The children built a snowman with a carrot nose
The snowman melted when temperatures rose above freezing
Every winter they compete to build the tallest snowman
The yard featured a family of snowmen

definitions: motorized vehicle designed for winter travel over snow with skis and tracks
examples: They explored the backcountry trails by snowmobile
The rescue team used snowmobiles to reach stranded hikers
Snowmobile rentals are available at the winter resort
The snowmobile race covered two hundred miles

definitions: flat device worn on foot to distribute weight for walking on snow without sinking
examples: Traditional snowshoes were made from wood and rawhide
She strapped on snowshoes for the winter hike
Modern snowshoes use aluminum frames and synthetic decking
Snowshoe racing has become a popular winter sport

definitions: heavy fall of snow accompanied by strong winds lasting several hours or days
examples: The snowstorm dumped three feet of snow overnight
Schools closed due to the approaching snowstorm
The historic snowstorm paralyzed the entire region
Travelers were stranded at airports during the snowstorm

definitions: deliberate act of ignoring or rejecting someone in a disdainful way
short and turned up at the tip, especially describing a nose
examples: Her snub at the ceremony was noticed by everyone
The award snub sparked controversy in the industry
The boxer's snub nose showed evidence of past fights
The boat had a snub bow design

definitions: powdered tobacco inhaled through the nose rather than smoked
act of extinguishing a candle or cutting a wick
examples: Aristocrats once carried ornate snuff boxes
He took a pinch of snuff from the tin
The altar boy's job included the snuff of candles
One snuff and the flame disappeared

definitions: period of being immersed in liquid to become thoroughly wet
person who drinks alcohol excessively
examples: The beans need an overnight soak before cooking
A long soak in the bath helped her relax
The old soak spent every evening at the bar
Don't become a soak like your uncle

definitions: act or state of being completely wet through
process of immersing something in liquid for a period
examples: The soaking from the rain ruined his shoes
After that soaking, we need dry clothes immediately
The stains require a soaking in bleach solution
Pre-soaking makes the laundry easier to clean

definitions: substance used with water for washing and cleaning made from fats or oils
television or radio drama series dealing with daily events of characters
examples: She lathered the soap between her hands before washing
This antibacterial soap kills ninety-nine percent of germs
The soap has been on air for thirty years
She watches her favorite soap every afternoon

definitions: improvised platform used for making public speeches
opportunity or medium for expressing one's views publicly
examples: The activist stood on a soapbox in the park
Speakers' Corner features many soapbox orators
Social media has become everyone's personal soapbox
He uses every meeting as a soapbox for his views

definitions: act of flying or gliding high in the air with little effort
rapid rise or increase in level, amount, or intensity
examples: The eagle's soaring above the canyon was majestic
Soaring requires finding thermal air currents
The soaring of prices has affected everyone's budget
Her soaring through the ranks impressed colleagues

definitions: convulsive catching of breath while crying with short gasping sounds
examples: Her sobs could be heard through the closed door
He tried to stifle his sobs during the funeral
The child's sobs gradually subsided into sniffles
Deep sobs shook her entire body

definitions: act of crying noisily with convulsive catching of breath
examples: The sobbing from the next room lasted for hours
Her uncontrollable sobbing worried her friends
The movie's ending left half the audience sobbing
Sobbing interfered with her ability to speak

definitions: state of not being affected by alcohol or maintaining abstinence from it
quality of being serious, sensible, and solemn in behavior
examples: He celebrated five years of sobriety last month
The breathalyzer confirmed the driver's sobriety
The judge's sobriety commanded respect in the courtroom
The situation calls for sobriety, not jokes

definitions: game played between two teams of eleven players using a round ball and feet
examples: Soccer is the most popular sport worldwide
The kids play soccer every Saturday morning
Professional soccer leagues exist in most countries
She received a soccer scholarship to university

definitions: quality of being friendly and enjoying the company of others
examples: Her natural sociability made her popular at parties
The job requires high sociability and communication skills
Dogs are known for their sociability with humans
Sociability decreases in some people as they age
